text.div:
NameCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
DocumentReference ResourceA reference to a document
A location or a service (or both) SHALL be provided
masterIdentifier 1..1IdentifierMaster Version Specific Identifier
identifier 0..*IdentifierOther identifiers for the document
subject 1..1Patient | Practitioner | Group | DeviceWho|what is the subject of the document
type 1..1CodeableConceptWhat kind of document this is (LOINC if possible)
DocumentType (??)
class 0..1CodeableConceptCategorization of Document
DocumentClass (??)
author 1..*Practitioner | Device | Patient | RelatedPersonWho and/or what authored the document
custodian 0..1OrganizationOrg which maintains the document
policyManager 0..1uriManages access policies for the document
authenticator 0..1Practitioner | OrganizationWho/What authenticated the document
created 0..1dateTimeDocument creation time
indexed 1..1instantWhen this document reference created
status 1..1codecurrent | superceded | entered in error
DocumentReferenceStatus (??)
docStatus 0..1CodeableConceptpreliminary | final | appended | amended | entered in error
ReferredDocumentStatus (??)
relatesTo ElementRelationships to other documents
code 1..1codereplaces | transforms | signs | appends
DocumentRelationshipType (??)
target 1..1DocumentReferenceTarget of the relationship
description 0..1stringHuman-readable description (title)
confidentiality 0..*CodeableConceptSensitivity of source document
DocumentConfidentiality (??)
primaryLanguage 0..1codeThe marked primary language for the document
Language (??)
mimeType 1..1codeMime type, + maybe character encoding
MimeType (??)
format 0..*uriFormat/content rules for the document
size 0..1integerSize of the document in bytes
hash 0..1stringHexBinary representation of SHA1
location 0..1uriWhere to access the document
service ElementIf access is not fully described by location
type 1..1CodeableConceptType of service (i.e. XDS.b)
DocumentServiceType (??)
address 0..1stringWhere service is located (usually a URL)
parameter ElementService call parameters
name 1..1stringParameter name in service call
value 0..1stringParameter value for the name
context ElementClinical context of document
event 0..*CodeableConceptMain Clinical Acts Documented
DocumentEventType (??)
period 0..1PeriodTime of service that is being documented
facilityType 0..1CodeableConceptKind of facility where patient was seen
DocumentFacilityType (??)

structure.purpose: This is the definition for the DocumentReference resource

definition.formal: A reference to a document.
definition.comments: Usually, this is used for documents other than those defined by FHIR.

constraint.name: Location
constraint.human: A location or a service (or both) SHALL be provided

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.formal: Document identifier as assigned by the source of the document. This identifier is specific to this version of the document. This unique identifier may be used elsewhere to identify this version of the document.
Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent, source record and workflow related identifiers.
definition.comments:
Other identifiers can also include Identifiers may be Accession Numbers, Order Numbers, Referral Request 
Identifiers, XDS Workflow Instance Identifiers.

definition.short: Who|what is the subject of the document
definition.formal: Who or what the document is about. The document can be about a person, (patient or healthcare practitioner), a device (I.e. machine) or even a group of subjects (such as a document about a herd of farm animals, or a set of patients that share a common exposure).

mapping.map: PID-3-Patient ID List (No standard way to define a Practitioner or Group subject in V2 MDM message)

definition.short: What kind of document this is (LOINC if possible)
definition.formal: Specifies the particular kind of document (e.g. Patient Summary, Discharge Summary, Prescription, etc.).
definition.comments: Key metadata element describing the document, used in searching/filtering.

definition.formal: A categorization for the type of the document. This may be implied by or derived from the code specified in the Document Type.
definition.comments: Helps humans to assess whether the document is of interest when viewing an index of documents.

definition.short: Who and/or what authored the document
definition.formal: Identifies who is responsible for adding the information to the document.
definition.comments: Not necessarily who did the actual data entry (i.e. typist) it in or who was the source (informant).

mapping.map: TXA-9-Originator Code/Name (No standard way to indicate a Device in V2 MDM message)

definition.formal: Identifies the organization or group who is responsible for ongoing maintenance of and access to the document.
definition.comments: Identifies the logical organization to go to find the current version, where to report issues, etc. This is different from the physical location of the document, which is the technical location of the document, which host may be delegated to the management of some other organization.

definition.short: Manages access policies for the document
definition.formal: A reference to a domain or server that manages policies under which the document is accessed and/or made available.
Which person or organization authenticates that this document is valid.
When the document was created.
definition.comments: Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching. This is the creation time of the document, not the source material on which it is based.

definition.formal: When the document reference was created.
definition.comments: Referencing/indexing time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching.

definition.formal: The status of this document reference.

binding.name: DocumentReferenceStatus
binding.description: The status of the document reference

definition.short: preliminary | final | appended | amended | entered in error
definition.formal: The status of the underlying document.
Relationships that this document has with other document references that already exist.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The type of relationship that this document has with anther document.
definition.comments: If this document appends another document, then the document cannot be fully understood without also accessing the referenced document.

binding.name: DocumentRelationshipType
binding.description: The type of relationship between documents

definition.formal: The target document of this relationship.
Human-readable description of the source document. This is sometimes known as the "title".
definition.comments: What the document is about, rather than a terse summary of the document. It is commonly the case that records do not have a title and are collectively referred to by the display name of Record code (e.g. a "consultation" or "progress note").

definition.formal: A code specifying the level of confidentiality of the XDS Document.
definition.comments: The interpretation of this field, and more generally enforcement and issues related to highly sensitive documents are beyond the scope of this resource. confidentialityCode can only be understood in the context of the policies, procedures, and value set specified by the context in which the document reference is being used.

binding.name: DocumentConfidentiality
binding.description: Codes specifying the level of confidentiality of the composition

definition.short: The marked primary language for the document
definition.formal: The primary language in which the source document is written.
The mime type of the source document.
definition.comments: Note: application/hl7-v3+xml for CDA. application/binary for proprietary record formats.

binding.name: MimeType
binding.description: The mime type of an attachment

definition.formal: An identifier that identifies that the format and content of the document conforms to additional rules beyond the base format indicated in the mimeType.
definition.comments: Most often used when the mime-type is text/xml.

definition.short: Size of the document in bytes
definition.formal: The size of the source document this reference refers to in bytes.
A hash of the source document to ensure that changes have not occurred.
definition.comments: Whether the hash must be present and/or correct depends on the document handling rules defined in the context of use.

definition.formal: A url at which the document can be accessed.

mapping.map: (Might include V2 TXA-16-Unique Document File Name or TXA-24-Folder Assignment)

definition.short: If access is not fully described by location
definition.formal: A description of a service call that can be used to retrieve the document.
definition.comments: If a document can be accessed by either a service or directly by a URL (i.e. an XDS repository with an MHD access point, or a DICOM network with a WADO portal) just provide the URL.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The type of the service that can be used to access the documents.
definition.comments: The meaning and interpretation of the parameters depends on the service type.

definition.short: Where service is located (usually a URL)
definition.formal: Where the service end-point is located.
definition.comments: Usually this is a URL, but for some services, the end-point is a simple network name or address that is not a valid URL.

definition.formal: A list of named parameters that is used in the service call.
definition.comments: The interpretation of the parameters, and how to convert them into a proper service call, is dependent on the type of the service, and needs to be specified in an implementation guide somewhere.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The name of a parameter.
The value of the named parameter.
The clinical context in which the document was prepared.
definition.comments: These values are primarily added to help with searching for interesting/relevant documents.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts, such as a colonoscopy or an appendectomy, being documented. In some cases, the event is inherent in the typeCode, such as a "History and Physical Report" in which the procedure being documented is necessarily a "History and Physical" act.
definition.comments:
An event can further specialize the act inherent in the type, such as 
where it is simply "Procedure Report" and the procedure was a "colonoscopy". If one or more event codes are included, they shall not conflict with the values inherent in the class or type elements as such a conflict would create an ambiguous situation.

binding.name: DocumentEventType
binding.description: This list of codes represents the main clinical acts being documented

definition.short: Time of service that is being documented
definition.formal: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided.

definition.short: Kind of facility where patient was seen
definition.formal: The kind of facility where the patient was seen.
A reference to a document.
definition.comments: Usually, this is used for documents other than those defined by FHIR.

constraint.human: A location or a service (or both) SHALL be provided

Other identifiers associated with the document, including version independent, source record and workflow related identifiers.

Other identifiers can also include Identifiers may be Accession Numbers, Order Numbers, Referral Request

When the document was created.
definition.comments: Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching. This is the creation time of the document, not the source material on which it is based.

definition.short: Time of service that is being documented
definition.formal: The time period over which the service that is described by the document was provided.

definition.short: Kind of facility where patient was seen
definition.formal: The kind of facility where the patient was seen.

searchParam.name: _id
searchParam.documentation: The logical resource id associated with the resource (must be supported by all servers)

searchParam.name: _language
searchParam.documentation: The stated language of the resource

searchParam.name: author
searchParam.documentation: Who and/or what authored the document

searchParam.name: facility
searchParam.documentation: Kind of facility where patient was seen

searchParam.name: language
searchParam.documentation: The marked primary language for the document

searchParam.name: period
searchParam.documentation: Time of service that is being documented

searchParam.name: size
searchParam.documentation: Size of the document in bytes

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Who|what is the subject of the document

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: What kind of document this is (LOINC if possible)
